intro: Calochortus simulans, commonly known as the showy onion or the California mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its bulbs are edible and have been used by indigenous peoples for food and medicinal purposes. Calochortus simulans is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and adaptability to various garden conditions.
